description:
The second cour of SYNDUALITY Noir.

Despite returning victorious from a dangerous struggle, Kanata and his friends have, in a sense, lost a key ally, the amnesiac magus Noir. Having partially recovered her memory, Noir reverted back to her former personality: that of Mystere, who acts in a patronizing manner toward her master Kanata. However, Mystere remembers detecting a signal from Histoire, a mystical city, during her former life as an artificially intelligent magus.

Meanwhile, Tokio disappears from Rock Town while hunting down the ghosts of his past; however, shocking revelations await the deeper his search goes. As Kanata, his childhood friend Ellie, and the magus diva Ciel set out for Histoire, a hostile organization named Ideal sends assassins after them. If Kanata wants to stand a chance at accomplishing his dream, he must uncover the unpleasant truth about Ideal—and some of his closest allies.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/neco_person) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/777703)

Not to be confused with mangaka under the same name, [neco](https://anilist.co/staff/125721).

Hajime Kamoshida is a Japanese novelist and scriptwriter. His best known works are light novel series [The Pet Girl of Sakurasou](https://anilist.co/manga/60051/Sakurasou-no-Pet-na-Kanojo/) and [Rascal Does Not Dream of Bunny Girl Senpai](https://anilist.co/manga/91170/Rascal-Does-Not-Dream-of-Bunny-Girl-Senpai/) which have received manga and anime adaptations. His debut work was [Saga of a World Without God](https://anilist.co/manga/132223/Kaminaki-Sekai-no-Eiyuuden/) in 2007.

ARCANA PROJECT is a 6-member girl's vocal unit jointly produces by Lantis and DEARSTAGE featuring tarot cards. Mia_REGINA directs songs and dances. 
They made their debut on January 18, 2020, followed by their first organized live "ACE of CUPS" named after minor arcana.

The outfits are based on common design with personalized detail.

Two of them have just joined to DS Gaming Team to appear at eSports contests as well.

They released their pre-debut single ACE of WANDS on March 25, 2020. Due to the COVID-19 outbreak, all release events in March are canceled.

Currently they are performing occasionally at LINELIVE as a whole or part where membership is available instead of appearing at live house due to stayhome situation.

They have proudly announced that they will perform the opening theme for the Monster Girl Doctor Anime which will be airing on 2020 summer. They will release the song as their first single named カンパネラ響く空で(Campanella Hibiku Sora de)

__[Profile (Lantis)](http://www.lantis.jp/artist/stereodivefoundation/bio.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__

__Stereo Dive Foundation__ is the solo sound making project of Japanese musician [Ryuuta Iida](https://anilist.co/staff/106037), otherwise known as Ron (stylized as R・O・N)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/64664693)

Yamamoto's interest in working in the anime industry piqued in high school after realizing how noticeable the difference in episodes were depending on the episode director in charge. One of his favourites shows included [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/).

In the late '80s, he joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant after finding out that it's how many of the studio's directors started off. There he met and studied under [Shuuji Iuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/115833/) on his shows [Madou King Granzort](https://anilist.co/anime/2818/) and [Mashin Eiyuuden Wataru](https://anilist.co/anime/4807/). Then after having gone freelance he got his first shot as a director as one of the three unit directors on Iuchi's [Ranma ½ film](https://anilist.co/anime/418/) in 1991.

In 2001, Yamamoto made his debut as a series director on [Shiawase Sou no Okojo-san](https://anilist.co/anime/2934/), soon after which he worked as the first director of the long-running [Keroro Gunsou](https://anilist.co/anime/516/). In 2006 he directed the well-received [NHK ni Youkoso!](https://anilist.co/anime/1210/)

More recent directorial works of his include [Yama no Susume](https://anilist.co/anime/14355/) and [Shounen Maid](https://anilist.co/anime/21321/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kadutaka_nue)

Kazutaka Miyatake is a visual artist and anime designer known for the mechanical design of the Macross TV series and a number of its continuations from Studio Nue, of which he is a founding member. He has also contributed to the mecha design of other series such as Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny.

Kazutaka Miyatake has designed the spaceships of several famous anime series. His attention to detail and mechanical realism have made his designs still admired upon and used in anime series and related products after several years of their initial appearance.
Masato Nakayama is a composer and former member of the music production group Elements Garden.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).

__[Profile (Verygoo)](http://www.verygoo.jp/artists/ron/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__

__Ryuuta Iida__, also known by his stage name Ron (stylized as R・O・N) is a Japanese musician, arranger, composer, lyricist, sound producer, guitarist, keyboardist and singer. He was the sound producer and guitarist of Japanese rock band [OLDCODEX](https://anilist.co/staff/112151/OLDCODEX) along with seiyuu [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735) from 2009-2012.

He currently works under the artist management company Verygoo, has a solo vocal project called [Stereo Dive Foundation](https://anilist.co/staff/118710/Stereo-Dive-Foundation), is a member of the rock band [ROSARYHILL](http://rosaryhill.net/) (2008-) as a keyboardist and vocalist, and works as a music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/KNoW-NAME).

__[Profile (Verygoo)](http://www.verygoo.jp/artists/ron/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__
